message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper is about using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for natural language processing (NLP), which is a subfield of computer science that falls under the category of "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI). Specifically, the paper proposes a modified CNN with context-sensitive filters for text processing, which involves learning filters that are specific to the input sentence or document. This work also involves visualizing the learned filters, which could fall under the category of "Computer Vision" (cs.CV). Additionally, the paper presents benchmarks on four different NLP tasks, which could fall under the categories of "Computational Linguistics" (cs.CL) and "Information Retrieval" (cs.IR). Finally, the paper involves machine learning techniques for training and evaluating the proposed model, which could fall under the category of "Machine Learning" (cs.LG).
